sentence: Looking at options trading activity among components of the Russell 3000 index, there is noteworthy activity today in Home Depot Inc (Symbol: HD), where a total volume of 23,841 contracts has been traded thus far today, a contract volume which is representative of approximately 2.4 million underlying shares (given that every 1 contract represents 100 underlying shares).
That number works out to 41.3% of HD's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 5.8 million shares.
Particularly high volume was seen for the $160 strike call option expiring October 20, 2017 , with 2,730 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 273,000 underlying shares of HD.

Below is a chart showing HD's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $160 strike highlighted in orange:

Beazer Homes USA, Inc. (Symbol: BZH) options are showing a volume of 1,836 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 183,600 underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 41.1% of BZH's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 446,855 shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $17 strike call option expiring October 20, 2017 , with 476 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 47,600 underlying shares of BZH.

Below is a chart showing BZH's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $17 strike highlighted in orange:

And Polaris Industries Inc. (Symbol: PII) options are showing a volume of 2,909 contracts thus far today.
That number of contracts represents approximately 290,900 underlying shares, working out to a sizeable 41.1% of PII's average daily trading volume over the past month, of 707,140 shares.
Especially high volume was seen for the $105 strike call option expiring September 15, 2017 , with 1,260 contracts trading so far today, representing approximately 126,000 underlying shares of PII.

Below is a chart showing PII's trailing twelve month trading history, with the $105 strike highlighted in orange:
